lead_paragraph: The off-campus bonfire organized by Texas A&M students is on again after the Robertson County Commissioners Court lifted a burn ban, according to the student Web site for the event. Last week, commissioners voted to impose the ban because of dry conditions and strong winds. They lifted the ban yesterday in most precincts, including the one where the bonfire is held, and the traditional event was rescheduled for tonight.
